Reviews.Title: “Great Place with nice people”
Reviews.Author: Typvonnebenan
Reviews.Content: This is a great Place loacated directly at the Bosphorus. The rooms are extremely nice and most have a view. Due to the small amount of rooms we always felt like beeing the only guests. Peolple are friendly and helpful. Tip: If you stay more than one night ask for a special breakfast. Otherwise they bring you the same plate of varieties every day. They are good but could be a bit boring. Downside: they definitely have a problem with their Aircon: Everytime I stayed there it was extremely warm in the room. Tip: when you check in, ask if they have an upgrade. The difference between the tiny rooftop room and a normal room is hughe and can completely change your holiday experience. Also regarding view: we have had a balcony to the Bosphorus (great) and at another time basically the wall of another building in front of the windows :-(

Reviews.Title: “Watching the ships go by and eating fresh fish”
Reviews.Author: Laura B
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a delightful location. On the Asian side it feels much more like a "real" place than Sultanahmet, although obviously sightseeing (apart from boat trips) is harder. The restaurants are better, in particular the service, and far better value. This hotel is just by a little seafront square which has a great range of fish and other restaurants. The hotel breakfasts are good too. The highlight is of course the ships going right past your window - you can watch them for hours (and at marinetraffic dot com you can find out where they came from and where they are going too). But the rooms were well-appointed and luxurious as well. And the staff were lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff, Beautiful Hotel, Amazing views”
Reviews.Author: caroline m
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel, the staff were lovely from the minute we arrived. Our room was a Deluxe Bosphorus View . It was lovely, real attention to detail. Right down to the telephone. We thought the views of the Bosphorus were wonderful. Nothing was to much trouble for the staff. We followed the receptionist advice and got the ferry to the European side of Istanbul.It was great. I would have no hesitation in recommending this Hotel every time. We will return!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon Hotel By The Bridge”
Reviews.Author: captainergun
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel after our wedding party in Istanbul. Highlights of our stay were stunning view of Bosphorus, great breakfast service to the room and great decoration of the Hotel. Only windows has to be cleaned. If you want to stay by the Bosphorus this Hotel or Palace defineatly suits to you.

Reviews.Title: “a very romantic butik hotel!”
Reviews.Author: desislava t
Reviews.Content: the bosphorus palace hotel is a very quite and romantic place where the history meets the modern istanbul.silens...sea...lights of the bridges...exellent service...best quality of food and very good location.

Reviews.Title: “Ä°t was living in the past”
Reviews.Author: Mustafagozu
Reviews.Content: Ä°t was perfect except breakfast. The location of the hotel and dining room is very good,it's like being on the sea ,but the breakfast was ordinary

Reviews.Title: “HappyAsLarry”
Reviews.Author: Kees L
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Bosphorus Palace for 2 nights. The people at reception were friendly and the room was fantastic. It was magic to just sit in our room at the windows and see the great ships passing by. The table we had in the dining room was in an enchanting spot, looking out through the porch of the old boat launching area. Dinner and breakfasts were excellent. The staff were friendly and made us very welcome. Going back to Istanbul will be going back to the Bosphorus Palace for us.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed emotions”
Reviews.Author: aeilat
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights. Service was very good. My first room was ok- but too small, the AC was right on the bed which was hard to use and the Mosque nearby made too much noise at the wrong time. The second room was vey nice, big and comfortable (and further away from the Mosque). Location was nice if you do business on the Asian side. Area is nice for a walk to nearby restaurants, views are nice as well as excellent breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and nice athmosphere..”
Reviews.Author: Kayahan O
Reviews.Content: We had 2 Business Appointments and probabely have choosen the right place for that. I'd like to place just one comment ; service stuff should speak little better english, specially in A-la-kart area.. We absolutely will visit you again. Thank you so much.

Reviews.Title: “All hail the Bosphorus Palace!”
Reviews.Author: zlytwyn
Reviews.Content: A true touch of ottoman opulence in modern day Istanbul. Breathtaking on every level.

Reviews.Title: “CHARMING, SMALL AND VERY COMFORTABLE”
Reviews.Author: marvthemarv
Reviews.Content: We had previously spent some time in Istanbul so when we asked the bride to whose wedding we were invited where we should stay she told us that this hotel was near the venue and a comfortable place for a couple of nights. It was easy to understand that this was previously a "palace" for a very rich individual. We had a room overlooking the Bosphorus. It was adequately furnished in a sort of 1930s way. It was very light and bright as was the bathroom. We arrived quite late but the restaurant was still open and a fine light meal was a pleasure after hours of delay at the airport and through the nightmare that is Istanbul`s traffic. Having only eight or nine rooms the breakfast buffet was adequate as opposed to being lavish but individual requests were pleasantly complied with. The desk staff were very helpful. Apart from the early morning call to prayer from a nearby mosque I can suggest that for somebody who wishes to stay on the Asian side this is as good as it gets with the ferry across the Bosphorus to the Grand Bazaar only a ten minute 10TL cab ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: AndreS055
Reviews.Content: The Bosphorus Palace is an elegant old home tastefully converted into a hotel. Our room was lovely directly overlooking the Bosphorus and the amenities that were on par with other hotels of this standard. When we discovered the windows could be opened it was wonderful to sleep with the sound of the water just out the window. The staff was very courteous and helpful and the location great for food close by. However there were no good English or French TV stations for news or entertainment and the hotel food was just ok not great. We were doing business on the Asia side so this was good for us but internet access was difficult. For fun we enjoyed the adventure of the ferry and local transport and of course taxies were abundant when we needed to move.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: CJM2010060
Reviews.Content: nice hotel, great view and really helpful and friendly staff. Room was great and the breakfast was very nice. Good value as breakfast and internet were included in room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - little far from the main sites.”
Reviews.Author: CCastleWestMalling
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely , luxury Hotel on the banks on the Bosphorus with gorgeous views and comfortable rooms. However it is a little far away from the main sites of the City so if its your first trip to Istanbul you are probably better off staying in Sultanameh. However if you're all done with sightseeing and shopping then this is the perfect place to relax. Lovely fish restaurants just round the corner with spectacular views of the Bosphorus.

Reviews.Title: “A Fairytale by the Bosphorus”
Reviews.Author: Taslardan
Reviews.Content: I had thde pleasure of spending my 34th birthday at the Bosphorus Palace Hotel which was the perfect choice! It is a newly renovated mension by the Asian side of the Bosphorus with a certain serenity, style and luxury. They made me feel like a queen, sending chocolates and birthday cakes to our room. They have upgraded our room without even asking :) The hotel employees are just too good to be true. They did everything for us to feel special and enjoy the beauty of the place. Even though we spend just one night, we rested so much that it felt like a week! An incredible experience indeed. Highly recommended....

Reviews.Title: “Like a Agatha Christie novel”
Reviews.Author: yesmasterjedi
Reviews.Content: Avesome location, oldish style perfect building, friendly and helpful stuff. Their cooks are also very good, we enjoyed in the middle of Bosphorus. The only thing that I would moan is the prices but they are open to bargain.

Reviews.Title: “dream hotel dream location lovely bosphorus”
Reviews.Author: dariaUk
Reviews.Content: I wish I had the millions to buy the hotel , make it my home own home and live there for the rest of my life....such a nice historical building which was owned by an Ottoman Pasha many years ago, on one of the best locations in Istanbul...i can't think of a better location and view.....you just need to see it for your eyes

HotelInfo.Name: Bosphorus Palace
HotelInfo.Address: Yaliboyu Cad 64 | Beylerbeyi, Istanbul 34676, Turkey
